member.name: T:Akka.Actor.ActorPath
member.summary: Actor path is a unique path to an actor that shows the creation path up through the actor tree to the root actor. ActorPath defines a natural ordering (so that ActorRefs can be put into collections with this requirement); this ordering is intended to be as fast as possible, which owing to the bottom-up recursive nature of ActorPath is sorted by path elements FROM RIGHT TO LEFT, where RootActorPath > ChildActorPath in case the number of elements is different. Two actor paths are compared equal when they have the same name and parent elements, including the root address information. That does not necessarily mean that they point to the same incarnation of the actor if the actor is re-created with the same path. In other words, in contrast to how actor references are compared the unique id of the actor is not taken into account when comparing actor paths.

INTERNAL API.
Support interface for implementing a stash for an actor instance. A default stash per actor (= user stash) is maintained by by extending this interface. Actors that explicitly need other stashes can create new stashes via .

member.summary: Adds the current message (the message that the Actor received last) to the actor's stash. In the event of a stash capacity violation If the same message has been stashed more than once

member.name: M:Akka.Actor.IStashSupport.UnstashInternal
member.summary:
Prepends the oldest message in the stash to the mailbox, and the removes that message from the stash.
Messages from the stash are enqueued to the mailbox until the capacity of the mailbox (if any) has been reached. In case a bounded mailbox overflows, an exception is thrown.
The unstashed message is guaranteed to be removed from the stash regardless if the unstash call successfully returns or throws an exception.

member.summary: Prepends selected messages in the stash, applying to the mailbox, and then clears the stash.
member.param: Only stashed messages selected by this predicate are prepended to the mailbox.

member.summary: Prepends all messages to the mailbox, without a predicate.

member.name: M:Akka.Actor.SupervisorStrategy.HandleFailure(Akka.Actor.ActorCell,Akka.Actor.ActorRef,System.Exception)
member.summary: This is the main entry point: in case of a child’s failure, this method must try to handle the failure by resuming, restarting or stopping the child (and returning `true`), or it returns `false` to escalate the failure, which will lead to this actor re-throwing the exception which caused the failure. The exception will not be wrapped. This method calls [[Akka.Actor.SupervisorStrategy#LogFailure]], which will log the failure unless it is escalated. You can customize the logging by setting [[Akka.Actor.SupervisorStrategy#LoggingEnabled]] to `false` and do the logging inside the `decider` or override the `LogFailure` method.

member.name: M:Akka.Actor.SupervisorStrategy.DefaultDecider(System.Exception)
member.summary: When supervisorStrategy is not specified for an actor this [[Decider]] is used by default in the supervisor strategy. The child will be stopped when [[Akka.Actor.ActorInitializationException]], [[Akka.Actor.ActorKilledException]], or [[Akka.Actor.DeathPactException]] is thrown. It will be restarted for other `Exception` types. The error is escalated if it's a `Exception`, i.e. `Error`.

member.name: P:Akka.Actor.SupervisorStrategy.DefaultStrategy

member.name: T:Akka.Routing.Resizer
member.summary: [[Pool]] routers with dynamically resizable number of routees are implemented by providing a Resizer implementation in the [[akka.routing.Pool]] configuration

member.name: M:Akka.Routing.Resizer.IsTimeForResize(System.Int64)
member.summary:
Is it time for resizing. Typically implemented with modulo of nth message, but could be based on elapsed time or something else. The messageCounter starts with 0 for the initial resize and continues with 1 for the first message. Make sure to perform initial resize before first message (messageCounter == 0), because there is no guarantee that resize will be done when concurrent messages are in play.
CAUTION: this method is invoked from the thread which tries to send a message to the pool, i.e. the ActorRef.!() method, hence it may be called concurrently.

member.name: M:Akka.Routing.Resizer.Resize(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Akka.Routing.Routee})
member.summary:
Decide if the capacity of the router need to be changed. Will be invoked when `isTimeForResize` returns true and no other resize is in progress.
Return the number of routees to add or remove. Negative value will remove that number of routees. Positive value will add that number of routess. 0 will not change the routees.
This method is invoked only in the context of the Router actor.

member.name: T:Akka.Routing.DefaultResizer
member.summary: Implementation of [[Resizer]] that adjust the [[Pool]] based on specified thresholds.

member.name: F:Akka.Routing.DefaultResizer.lowerBound
member.summary: The fewest number of routees the router should ever have.

member.name: F:Akka.Routing.DefaultResizer.upperBound
member.summary: The most number of routees the router should ever have. Must be greater than or equal to `lowerBound`.

member.name: F:Akka.Routing.DefaultResizer.pressureThreshold
member.summary:
* Threshold to evaluate if routee is considered to be busy (under pressure). Implementation depends on this value (default is 1).
0: number of routees currently processing a message.
1: number of routees currently processing a message has some messages in mailbox.
> 1: number of routees with at least the configured `pressureThreshold` messages in their mailbox. Note that estimating mailbox size of default UnboundedMailbox is O(N) operation.

member.name: F:Akka.Routing.DefaultResizer.rampupRate
member.summary: Percentage to increase capacity whenever all routees are busy. For example, 0.2 would increase 20% (rounded up), i.e. if current capacity is 6 it will request an increase of 2 more routees.

member.name: F:Akka.Routing.DefaultResizer.backoffThreshold
member.summary:
Minimum fraction of busy routees before backing off. For example, if this is 0.3, then we'll remove some routees only when less than 30% of routees are busy, i.e. if current capacity is 10 and 3 are busy then the capacity is unchanged, but if 2 or less are busy the capacity is decreased.
Use 0.0 or negative to avoid removal of routees.

member.name: F:Akka.Routing.DefaultResizer.backoffRate
member.summary: Fraction of routees to be removed when the resizer reaches the backoffThreshold. For example, 0.1 would decrease 10% (rounded up), i.e. if current capacity is 9 it will request an decrease of 1 routee.

member.name: F:Akka.Routing.DefaultResizer.messagesPerResize
member.summary: Number of messages between resize operation. Use 1 to resize before each message.

member.name: M:Akka.Routing.DefaultResizer.#ctor(Akka.Configuration.Config)
member.summary: Creates a new DefaultResizer from the given configuration

member.name: M:Akka.Routing.DefaultResizer.Capacity(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Akka.Routing.Routee})
member.summary: Returns the overall desired change in resizer capacity. Positive value will add routees to the resizer. Negative value will remove routees from the resizer
member.param: The current actor in the resizer
member.returns: the number of routees by which the resizer should be adjusted (positive, negative or zero)

member.name: M:Akka.Routing.DefaultResizer.Filter(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: This method can be used to smooth the capacity delta by considering the current pressure and current capacity.
member.param: pressure current number of busy routees

member.name: M:Akka.Routing.DefaultResizer.Backoff(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Computes a proposed negative (or zero) capacity delta using the configured `backoffThreshold` and `backoffRate`
member.param: pressure current number of busy routees
member.returns: proposed decrease in capacity (as a negative number)

member.name: M:Akka.Routing.DefaultResizer.Rampup(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Computes a proposed positive (or zero) capacity delta using the configured `rampupRate`.
member.param: the current number of busy routees
the current number of total routees

member.name: M:Akka.Routing.DefaultResizer.Pressure(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Akka.Routing.Routee})
member.summary:
Number of routees considered busy, or above 'pressure level'.
Implementation depends on the value of `pressureThreshold` (default is 1).
0: number of routees currently processing a message.
1: number of routees currently processing a message has some messages in mailbox.
> 1: number of routees with at least the configured `pressureThreshold` messages in their mailbox. Note that estimating mailbox size of default UnboundedMailbox is O(N) operation.

member.name: T:Akka.Routing.RoundRobinGroup
member.summary:
A router group that uses round-robin to select a routee. For concurrent calls, round robin is just a best effort.
The configuration parameter trumps the constructor arguments. This means that if you provide `paths` during instantiation they will be ignored if the router is defined in the configuration file for the actor being used.

member.name: T:Akka.Util.Switch
member.summary: An atomic switch that can be either on or off

member.name: M:Akka.Util.Switch.SwitchOff(System.Action)
member.summary: Executes the provided action if the lock is on. This is done under a lock so be _very_ careful with longrunning/blocking operations in it. Only executes the action if the switch is on, and switches it off immediately after obtaining the lock. Will switch it back on if the provided action throws an exception.
member.returns: Returns true if the switch was switched off

member.name: M:Akka.Util.Switch.SwitchOn(System.Action)
member.summary: Executes the provided action if the lock is off. This is done under a lock so be _very_ careful with longrunning/blocking operations in it. Only executes the action if the switch is off, and switches it on immediately after obtaining the lock. Will switch it back off if the provided action throws an exception.
member.returns: Returns true if the switch was switched on

member.name: M:Akka.Util.Switch.SwitchOff
member.summary: Switches the switch off (if on). Uses locking.
member.returns: Returns true if the switch was switched off

member.name: M:Akka.Util.Switch.SwitchOn
member.summary: Switches the switch on (if off). Uses locking.
member.returns: Returns true if the switch was switched on

member.name: M:Akka.Util.Switch.IfOn(System.Action)
member.summary: Executes the provided action and returns if the action was executed or not, if the switch is IMMEDIATELY on (i.e. no lock involved)
member.returns: Return true if the switch was on

member.name: M:Akka.Util.Switch.IfOff(System.Action)
member.summary: Executes the provided action and returns if the action was executed or not, if the switch is IMMEDIATELY off (i.e. no lock involved)
member.returns: Return true if the switch was off

member.name: M:Akka.Util.Switch.WhileOn(System.Action)
member.summary: Executes the provided action and returns if the action was executed or not, if the switch is on, waiting for any pending changes to happen before (locking) Be careful of longrunning or blocking within the provided action as it can lead to deadlocks or bad performance

member.name: M:Akka.Util.Switch.WhileOff(System.Action)
member.summary: Executes the provided action and returns if the action was executed or not, if the switch is off, waiting for any pending changes to happen before (locking) Be careful of longrunning or blocking within the provided action as it can lead to deadlocks or bad performance

member.name: P:Akka.Util.Switch.IsOn
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this switch is on. No locking.
member.value: true if this instance is on; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Akka.Util.Switch.IsOff
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this switch is off. No locking.
member.value: true if this instance is off; otherwise, false.
